answers.answer: I am not a doctor, but a community leader. The doctor should answer you tomorrow. I am sorry to hear of your eye concerns.Welcome to our community.

Only your Eye MD ophthalmologist can answer that question. Recurrent vitreous hemorrhage is serious and could lead to blindness. It's important to know what this is happening.The most common cause would be diabetes.JCH III MD

question: I had my Vitreous hemorrhage 2 year before, when I wake up early in the morning I saw black spots in lefy eyeare obstructing the vision.  I approached an Optholmogist, he treated me without mentioning the disease nameby giving a eye drop.Later in June-2008, suddenly again eye vision blurred and after 5 days of diminishing the vision I went afamous Eye institue in Hyderabad, India.  They said its Vitreous hemorrhage and the gave me laser treatment.This has recurred thrice until now, October,2007 and feb,2008 and may,2008.  Now, I am an employee for acompany in Middle East.  Becz, company is not giving medical insurance, I approached an Indian famous OptholmogistHe gave me a good cheaper treatment for 2 recurrances by giving accular, Catalin and fluca like eye drops whichhelped a lot in obsorbing the blood to 90%.Now It recurred for 3rd time.MY QUESTION IS , WILL IT CAUSES BLINDNESS IF NOT TREATED IN TIME?????Pls. give me guidance @ your earliest..Thanks and Regards***@****
title: WILL recurrent Vitreous hemorrhage causes BLINDNESS?
